history.narrative: Law 2-105, the “Underground Excavation Enforcement Act of 1978,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 2-246, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Consumer Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 30, 1978 and June 13, 1978, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 5, 1978, it was assigned Act No. 2-217 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
